intro: Conyza wallichii, commonly known as the common ragweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in agricultural fields. Conyza wallichii is known for its allergenic pollen, which can cause respiratory issues in sensitive individuals.
